columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to determine the number of shares needed to be sold.

Let us first identify the given amounts in the problem: 


| | Amount$\hspace{5pt}$| 
|:--|--:| 
|Amount of funds needed to be raised | $60 million |
|Offer price  | $21.00 | 
|Spread  |7%|
|Filing fee and associated administrative expenses | $1,200,000.00|

First, let us determine the required amount of the proceeds from sales. As we have seen in the problem, the company has to raise funds amounting to $60 million. Hence, the flotation cost from this amount is deducted. 

Moreover, the filing fee and administrative expenses will be added to the raised amounts. We will use this information to determine the sales proceeds. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Amount of funds to raise }&={\text{S $\times$ (1 - FC)}}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where: 

S = Sales proceeds 

FC = Flotation costs

We will use the formula from step 3 to compute the sales proceeds. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{\$60 million + \$1.2 million }&={\text{S $\times$ (1 - 7\%)}}\\
\text{\$61. 2 million }&={\text{S $\times$ 0.93}}\\
\text{\$61. 2 million }&={\text{0.93S}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Then, let us divide both sides by 0.93 to cancel out the coefficient of S. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\dfrac{\text{0.93S}}{{0.93}}&=\dfrac{\text{\$61.2 million}}{\text{0.93}}\\[10pt]
{\text{S}}&={\textbf{\$65,806,451.61}}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The company's sales proceeds needed from the sale of stocks amounts to $65,806,451.61.**
**To conclude, the number of shares needed to be sold is 3,133.641.**
